categories.name: MEV
categories.description: MEV and arbitrage bots.

categories.name: Trading
categories.description: Contracts whose primary objective is to trade tokens or NFTs based on arbitrage, MEV (Miner Extractable Value) or market-making strategies.

categories.name: Centralized Exchange
categories.description: Contracts or wallets under the control of centralized exchanges.

categories.name: Lending
categories.description: Contracts that enable lending with the use of collateral.

categories.name: Decentralized Exchange
categories.description: Contracts whose primary focus is on routing token swaps through liquidity pools (LPs).

categories.name: Derivative Exchange
categories.description: Contracts that facilitate the trading of derivatives, which are financial instruments deriving their value from an underlying asset or benchmark.

categories.name: Staking
categories.description: Contracts where the primary activity is staking tokens or LP positions. Additionally, LP pools are included here, as contributing tokens to an LP is considered a form of staking.

categories.name: NFT Fi
categories.description: Contracts that involve the financialization of NFTs, which includes lending NFTs.

categories.name: NFT Marketplace
categories.description: Platform contracts for the sale or minting of NFTs.

categories.name: ERC721
categories.description: Contracts that adhere to the ERC721 token standard. This category does not include NFTs received as deposit receipts.

categories.name: ERC1155
categories.description: Contracts that adhere to the ERC1155 token standard. This category does not include NFTs received as deposit receipts.

categories.name: Community
categories.description: Contracts designed to support social interactions, networking or education.

categories.name: Gambling
categories.description: Contracts that govern games of chance.

categories.name: Gaming
categories.description: Contracts that are integrated into digital games, providing functionalities such as tokenized in-game assets, character progression, and digital ownership. Unlike gambling contracts, the outcomes in these games are influenced by the player's decisions, strategies or skill rather than by chance alone.

categories.name: Native Transfers
categories.description: All native transfers (primarily ETH transfers, but the native token can vary depending on the L2).

categories.name: Stablecoin
categories.description: ERC20 token contracts whose primary purpose is to maintain a value pegged to a fiat currency.

categories.name: ERC20
categories.description: Contracts that adhere to the ERC20 token standard. This category does not include tokens received as deposit receipts or stablecoins.

categories.name: Middleware
categories.description: Contracts that facilitate communication and interoperability between different blockchain protocols.

categories.name: Account Abstraction (ERC4337)
categories.description: Contracts that adhere to the ERC4337 standard for account abstraction, including all entry point contracts.

categories.name: Inscriptions
categories.description: Contract that are used for inscribing calldata.

categories.name: Oracle
categories.description: Contracts that feed external, real-world data onto the blockchain.

categories.name: Decentralized Physical Infrastructure
categories.description: Infrastructure that supports decentralized operations, including but not limited to physical hardware and networks.

categories.name: Developer Tool
categories.description: Contracts that assist developers in creating, testing, and deploying smart contracts.

categories.name: Identity
categories.description: Contracts that provide digital identification and verification services on the blockchain.

categories.name: Privacy
categories.description: Contracts designed to enhance privacy for transactions and interactions on the blockchain.

categories.name: Insurance
categories.description: Contracts that provide risk management and insurance coverage for various aspects of blockchain and crypto operations.

categories.name: Airdrop
categories.description: Contracts that help to distribute tokens or NFTs to multiple wallet addresses.

categories.name: Payments
categories.description: Contracts that facilitate transactions and payments within the blockchain ecosystem.

categories.name: Others
categories.description: Miscellaneous utility contracts that do not fit into the other specified categories.

categories.name: Cross-Chain Communication
categories.description: Contracts that facilitate the exchange of information or data between different blockchain networks. This sub-category does not include contracts that facilitate actual token or NFT transfers.

categories.name: Bridge
categories.description: Contracts that facilitate cross-chain token or NFT transfers, enabling the movement of assets across various chains. This category includes cross-chain swap platforms, as users primarily utilize these DEXs to ensure better liquidity for their bridged assets.
